summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and for perjury in connection with 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts, conspiracy, and perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing minor victims with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. Alleged co-conspirator with Maxwell in the sexual abuse of minor girls as young as 14 from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement praising the bravery of the victims who came forward.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges and commended investigators for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors and, in some cases, participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged in a federal indictment unsealed in Manhattan.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14, during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition and Perjury
events.description: Maxwell testified under oath in a civil proceeding and is charged with making false statements (perjury) during these depositions.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts, and with perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein abused girls as young as 14 from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell's alleged methods included befriending victims, taking them on trips, normalizing sexual topics, and being present during abuse to put victims at ease.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell made false statements under oath during depositions in 2016, leading to separate perjury charges.
